comments.text: I want them to do Persuasion next. :)
comments.author: AuroraS 92

top_comment.text:
I actually find the actress's modern portrayal of Emma to be faithful to 
the book. She's supposed to be full of herself, overconfident in her 
abilities, and a little headstrong when it comes to getting what she wants 
(at least, at first). I feel she's being unintentionally funny in her 
exaggerated mannerisms. But what I love most about this interpretation is 
that we clearly see what Knightley has to put up with on a daily basis - 
his self-satisfied whistle at the end of the video says it all :)﻿
top_comment.author: WaywardPash

comments.text: +Amanda Hall At book stores most likely in the Classics section.

comments.text: Where can I find the book

comments.author: DayWatch

top_comment.text: The actress is no Lizzie. And a little full of herself. Sorry.﻿
top_comment.author: Rachel K Ewing

comments.text:
+Rachel K Ewing
Have you continued watching? I really didn't like this adaption at first 
because of how Emma was portrayed. I also read the books, and found her 
annoying and too righteous in this adaption. But her character has really 
changed and developed into a way more likeable one as the series 
progressed. You are totally entitled to not like the series/actress and to 
stop watching, but I would definitely encourage you to push through the 
beginning because it definitely gets better later on! :)
comments.author: May Streetxx (May Street)

comments.text:
Yes. But I found Lizzie likable with her flaws. I don't like this 
actress... sorry, I wanted to because I love Emma in the books, but I don't 
like this girl.
comments.author: Rachel K Ewing

comments.text:
+Rachel K Ewing You realize both Lizzie and Emma are full of themselves in 
different aspects? "Pride and Prejudice" wasn't just describing Darcy.
comments.author: lollipoplullabies

comments.text:
Yes, I've read the book. I love the book. And sorry, but my opinion is and 
remains that this actress isn't my Emma.
comments.author: Rachel K Ewing

comments.text:
Have you read the book? She is exactly like Austen's Emma would be in 
modern day.
comments.author: Yomara Alcala

comments.text:
Opinions do not need evidence. It's an opinion. I don't feel like watching 
more at the moment because the world is full of information to take in and 
I don't feel like taking this in. Maybe a friend of mine will change my 
mind someday, but rantings of the internet are doing nothing. And the 
comment I left wasn't that negative. I even said 'sorry' at the end because 
I wanted to like it and didn't. That's all there is to it.
comments.author: Rachel K Ewing

comments.text:
+Rachel K Ewing Hahaha well you're certainly entitled to your opinion, but 
there's really no reason to leave negative comments if you aren't going to 
defend them with evidence. The series isn't even halfway done, and 
approaching it with the attitude that you hate it no matter what seems a 
little close minded--it may surprise you yet.
comments.author: Genna Vieve

comments.text:
I do not think it's true to Austen. And you aren't going to change my mind. 
I read Emma and have seen adaptations I do like. This is not one of them. 
Sorry. I don't like the actress or interruption. That's allowed.
comments.author: Rachel K Ewing

comments.text:
+Rachel K Ewing "Knowing where it's going" isn't the point, and neither is 
whether the characters are flawed. They all are, obviously. But in LBD, you 
are supposed to like Lizzie and Lydia because their flaws are relatable and 
presented as such. But Emma's flaw is that she's full of herself, and 
unlikable. If the web series presented her as awesome and fun it wouldn't 
be faithful to the book, and personally, I'd much rather the series stay 
true to Jane Austen's view of the characters than change them to suit an 
audience who needs to automatically "love" a protagonist.
comments.author: Genna Vieve

comments.text:
I have read Emma. Know where it's going. Still don't like this actress's 
interpretation and I don't see it getting better. I loved the Lizzie 
actress and Lydia actress, even though both of them are flawed characters. 
Don't like this Emma.
comments.author: Rachel K Ewing

comments.text:
Have you read Emma...? Jane Austen wrote it because she wanted to start 
with a spoiled, self-interested heroine who wouldn't initially appeal to 
readers. So your opinion that she's full of herself suggests she's doing a 
good job. Lizzie Bennet is supposed to be appealing from the get-go, 
whereas Emma is most certainly not.
comments.author: Genna Vieve

captions.text:
Emma; Hello my lovelies! so this docu-entry is
how I got to be the amazing

awesome life maker person you see before
you today! It all started a couple years
ago after college when my dear dad said to me

my favorite daughter Emma you should
take this opportunity to figure out what
you want to do in life
but take your time, but that's when I said

bestest dad ever I don't need to take my
time because I already know

I am Emma Woodhouse and the people need
me you'll see!

"Imminent Success"
Written by Bernie Su

As I said before I'm a lifestyle coach
matchmaker and I am

all about the follow-through. I see my
clients from the temp job to the corner
office!

From the first date to the honeymoon! I
am there as long as they need me because

after all my client are the types of
people who won't know what they need

until I show it to them, and they always
thank me later!

Can you imagine a purpose more noble and
fulfilling than bettering the lives of
the people?!

Psh.. Of course you can't! Remember how I
said I was going to be like Oprah?

You get a better life! You get a
better life! Everybody gets better a better life!
Alex: Well, this seems like a good time

Emma: Alex, you get a better life! 
Alex: Well, that's a relief.

Emma:He'll thank me later!
Alex: So is this camera going to stay a thing?

Emma: Until I accept my award in lifetime achivement.
Alex: I  get it.

Alex: So did you talk to Annie?
Emma: Of course I did

Alex: And? 
Emma: and I took care of it.

Alex: Really? How?
Emma: We talked she said

things and I'm giving her time to get
over herself like any great friend would!

Alex: So she's still thinking about calling off the wedding. 
Emma:  But she hasn't yet!

Alex: And you believe she'll come around
Emma: And realize how much she loves Ryan!

And how their future lives together will be so perfect 
with their condo in Manhattan Beach, Beach House in Laguna
and their cabin in Whistler!

Alex: Detailed. 
Emma: Always.

Alex: To clarify, you're just betting that everything will workout?
Emma: I don't gamble, I know!

Alex: Hmm. Humor me for a minute.
Emma: A minute?
Emma: Really, you?
Emma: What are you doing?

Alex: Being humored. I'll just be right over here!
Annie: Hey Emma.

Emma: Hey Annie, how are you?
Annie: I'm good and I think I know why you're calling.

Emma: You do? 
Annie: Yeah. I'm going to need some more time to think.

Annie: I'm sorry.
Emma: Oh, but you aren't for sure yet?

Annie: Well it's kinda big decision 
Emma: Haha, yea!

Annie: When Ryan gets back from his expansion trip 
in a couple weeks we'll talk about it.

Emma: Does he know? Did you tell him? 
Annie: No. Not yet.

Annie: I need to be for sure on this. It's good
I have some time.

Emma: And you should most definitely take it!
Annie: I'm sorry Emma.

I know this handcuffs you in your business. I
hope you just understand that something I have --
Emma: Yeah, Annie.

Emma: Totally understand. Space, time you got
it! Well like i gotta go Alex is being all
crazy! Talk to you later bye!

Emma: She'll come around!
Alex: But what if --
Emma: No, No

Alex: What if she doesn't come around and she
actually cancels the wedding?

Emma: Don't be ridiculous she won't cancel the wedding 
Alex: And you're sure?

Emma: Of course I am sure. I am Emma Woodhouse!
Alex:  I got it.
Emma: Great, now would you mind? I would really like

to finish this segment about the imminent
future success of our vibrant company
Alex: Hmm

Alex: So speaking of our vibrant company 
Emma: And it's imminent future success
Alex:  Well, what's that streak that you're on?

Emma: Soon to be 20 for 20
Alex: I know

Alex: that you have faith but considering our
company's future success

how imminent would it be if by the slightest
chance a certain
engagement just happen to fall apart and
you perfect streak was broken?

Well I'm off to my office of  boredom 
and important stuff to ponder just that.
You have fun, Emma.
